str2: Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A spectacle, vision, that which is seen. From horao; something gazed at, i.e. A spectacle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To seek, search for, desire, require, demand. Of uncertain affinity; to seek; specially, to worship, or to plot.
To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
(Hebrew), Macedonia, a Roman province north of Achaia (Greece). From Makedon; Macedonia, a region of Greece.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From sun and bibazo (by reduplication) of the base of basis); to drive together, i.e. Unite, to infer, show, teach.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To call to myself, summon. Middle voice from pros and kaleo; to call toward oneself, i.e. Summon, invite.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From eu and aggelos; to announce good news especially the gospel.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
